intro: Alysicarpus muelleri var. clementii, commonly known as the slender cowpea, is a tropical legume characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers followed by elongated, cylindrical pods containing lens-shaped seeds. The plant is native to Australia and thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soils. It is often used as a forage crop due to its high nutritional value for livestock. Its botanical features make it an important species in both agricultural and ecological contexts.
